newsitem.title: DUBAI: Dubai Aluminum completes $503 mln expansion plan.
newsitem.headline: Dubai Aluminum completes $503 mln expansion plan.

text.p: Dubai Aluminum Company Ltd (Dubal) on Wednesday announced the completion of a major expansion project to increase capacity by over 50 percent to an annual 375,000 tonnes.
Dubal said in a statement the $503 million Falcon Project expansion would be formally opened on March 2.
Last month, Dubal commissioned the last two pots in the expansion, eight weeks ahead of schedule.
The project involved a 240-cell potline, two new gas turbines and changes to the carbon plant including a second green anode production line and a third anode baking kiln.

It also involved the construction of a new casthouse and modifications to the existing one including another ingot casting machine, a third direct chill caster and a second continuous homogenising plant.
Dubal's berth at Jebel Ali Port was also enhanced.

The company, which has invested $2.3 billion since the smelter originally began producing metal in 1979, employs over 1,800 people. It is the world's largest supplier of foundry alloy for the automobile wheel manufacturing indsutry.
